skill.name: AgentDB Semantic Vector Search
skill.description: Implement semantic vector search with AgentDB for intelligent document retrieval, similarity matching, and context-aware querying. Build RAG systems, semantic search engines, and knowledge bases.
skill.summary: Implement semantic vector search with AgentDB for intelligent document retrieval, similarity matchin...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing markdown SOP files with no executable code. This skill provides guidance for implementing vector search using AgentDB but contains no scripts, network calls, or filesystem access.

content.user_title: Build semantic vector search with AgentDB
content.value_statement: Users need intelligent document retrieval that understands meaning, not just keywords. This skill provides a 5-phase SOP to implement semantic vector search using AgentDB for RAG systems, knowledge bases, and context-aware querying.
actual_capabilities: Set up AgentDB vector database with embedding model configuration
Generate and store document embeddings with metadata
Build HNSW search index for optimized retrieval
Implement REST API query interface with filtering
Add hybrid search combining vector and keyword matching
Apply re-ranking to improve result relevance
limitations: Requires external embedding model API (OpenAI, Cohere, etc.)
AgentDB must be installed and configured separately
Does not include pre-built embedding generation code
Search accuracy depends on embedding model quality

use_cases.title: Build RAG Systems
use_cases.description: Create retrieval-augmented generation backends for LLMs with semantic search capability

use_cases.title: Document Search API
use_cases.description: Deploy semantic search endpoints for enterprise document retrieval systems

use_cases.title: Knowledge Base Queries
use_cases.description: Build intelligent knowledge bases with meaning-based document search and similarity matching

prompt_templates.title: Basic Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Use AgentDB to set up a semantic vector search system. Configure it with 1536 dimensions for OpenAI ada-002 embeddings. Show how to initialize the database and embedding model.

prompt_templates.title: Document Indexing
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement document embedding and storage. Process a corpus of documents, generate embeddings for each, and store them in AgentDB with metadata including title, content, and category.

prompt_templates.title: Search API
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a REST API endpoint for semantic search. Accept query text, generate embedding, search with topK parameter, apply metadata filters, and return ranked results.

prompt_templates.title: Hybrid Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement hybrid search combining vector similarity with keyword matching. Add re-ranking to improve relevance scores. Configure alpha parameter for vector/keyword balance.

output_examples.input: Search for 'machine learning tutorials' with category filter
output: Total results: 3 matching documents found in 45ms

best_practices: Use appropriate embedding dimensions for your model (1536 for OpenAI ada-002, 768 for sentence-transformers)
Apply metadata filtering to reduce search space and improve relevance for specific document types
Monitor query latency and adjust HNSW parameters (M, efConstruction) based on accuracy requirements
anti_patterns: Storing documents without metadata limits filtering and re-ranking capabilities
Using mismatched embedding dimensions causes indexing and search failures
Ignoring re-ranking reduces result quality for complex queries

faq.question: Which embedding models are compatible?
faq.answer: AgentDB supports OpenAI ada-002, sentence-transformers, Cohere, and any model producing fixed-dimensional vectors.

faq.question: What is the maximum document count?
faq.answer: AgentDB handles millions of vectors with HNSW indexing. Performance depends on available memory.

faq.question: Can this integrate with existing databases?
faq.answer: AgentDB runs alongside PostgreSQL, MongoDB, or any database. Use it as the vector layer only.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: AgentDB stores vectors locally. Embedding API calls go to your chosen provider with your credentials.

faq.question: Why are my search results poor?
faq.answer: Check embedding model quality, try re-ranking, adjust alpha for hybrid search, or increase topK for broader results.

faq.question: How does this compare to Pinecone or Weaviate?
faq.answer: AgentDB offers self-hosted deployment, no API fees, and tight integration with Claude Code workflows.
